name: betony
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with dark red flowers, used in traditional medicine and the past for dyeing (= changing the colour of cloth): We sat down by the riverbank among patches of betony. Patches of red-purple flowered betony flourish on the lighter soils.
More examplesFewer examplesBetony is easily mistaken for an orchid.The garden contains thistles, brambles, forget-me-nots, betony and ferns, dandelions, buttercups, clover, and more than 100 other wild species.Modern herbalists prescribe betony to treat a wide range of conditions.
